marketNews.title: Danantara Invests US$5 Billion in 2025; Rumor of a Capital Injection for GIAA
marketNews.content: Managing Director Finance BPI Danantara, Arief Budiman, said on Tuesday (6/3) that his party will disburse investments worth 5 billion US dollars or approximately 81 trillion rupiah until the end of 2025, which will be focused on 8 sectors. These funds were obtained from BUMN dividend receipts targeted to reach 120 trillion rupiah during 2025. The 8 sectors that will be the main focus of Danantara's investment are mineral downstreaming, new and renewable energy, digital infrastructure, healthcare services, financial services, infrastructure utilities, industrial estates, and food and agriculture. Arief explained that the selection of these sectors was based on considerations of their contribution to national economic growth and return opportunities. Arief also mentioned that aside from dividend reallocation, Danantara also hopes to obtain co-investment, whether in the form of funding, capability, or competitiveness that Indonesia does not yet possess. Arief's statement came amid news from Bloomberg that Danantara will inject capital of about 500 million US dollars or approximately 8.1 trillion rupiah to Garuda Indonesia ($GIAA). Bloomberg sources said that this capital injection is likely to occur in 2 stages, with an agreement on the initial stage possibly being reached as early as June or July 2025. Part of this capital injection is reported to be given to GIAA's subsidiary, Citilink, to restore the operations of more than a dozen of its fleet units in storage. If realized, this corporate action has the potential to become Danantara's first investment since its establishment in early 2025. Bloomberg sources also said that the government is considering transferring the control of Citilink to Pertamina, adding that discussions regarding this matter are still unclear and no decision has been made yet. Representatives of GIAA and Danantara declined to comment on this issue. Meanwhile, Pertamina told Bloomberg that the Ministry of State-Owned Enterprises (BUMN) once had an idea to merge Pelita Air and Citilink, although there is currently no new information. Pelita Air itself is controlled by Pertamina. The issue regarding the transfer of Citilink's control is new information, considering the government has been planning the consolidation of Pelita Air with GIAA and Citilink since 2023. Previously, Minister of BUMN, Erick Thohir, said in January 2025 that the consolidation of GIAA, Pelita Air, and Citilink is targeted to be completed within 6 months.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: Rumor capital injection from Danantara provides positive sentiment for GIAA shares, where its stock price strengthened +5.08% on Wednesday (4/6) and +72% since this rumor first emerged on May 16, 2025. Regarding Danantara's investment in general, from a capital market perspective, we assess how the utilization and management of Danantara's investment funds will have implications for foreign investor perception of the government. This will affect foreign investor confidence and appetite for the Indonesian market.

marketNews.title: Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD) Cuts Indonesia's Economic Growth Projection Again
marketNews.content: Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD) again cut Indonesia's economic growth projection to +4.7% YoY in 2025 and +4.8% YoY in 2026 in the outlook released in early June 2025, each lower by -0.2 percentage point compared to the outlook in March 2025. This also marks the second downward revision of the outlook by the OECD this year for Indonesia, following the revision in March 2025. For 2025 itself, the government targets economic growth of +5.2% YoY.

marketNews.title: US President Trump Signs Order Hiking Steel and Aluminum Tariffs to 50 Percent
marketNews.content: US President, Donald Trump, on Tuesday (3/6) signed an order to raise steel and aluminum tariffs from 25% to 50% effective June 4, 2025, justified as helping domestic producers and protecting US national security. Bloomberg mentioned that this new policy is based on a weaker legal ground, after the US International Trade Commission last week overturned many tariffs Trump imposed via emergency law. The new steel and aluminum tariff hike has an exception for the UK, where import tariffs on metals from the UK will remain at the 25% level to allow the US and the UK to continue trade negotiations before the deadline on July 9, 2025.

marketNews.title: Ray Dalio Acts as Informal Advisor to BPI Danantara Voluntarily and Unpaid
marketNews.content: Investor Daily reported that Bridgewater Associates founder, Ray Dalio, stated he acts as an informal advisor to BPI Danantara voluntarily and unpaid. Previously, Bloomberg reported last week that Dalio chose not to hold the position of Danantara advisor for undisclosed reasons. Bloomberg also mentioned that Dalio's name is no longer listed among Danantara's advisory members, based on the entity's presentation slides to a group of foreign businessmen in May 2025. This Bloomberg report was denied by BPI Danantara CEO, Rosan Roeslani.

marketNews.title: Indonesia Vows to Provide US Tariff Preferences Before June Talks
marketNews.content: Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs, Airlangga Hartarto, said on Wednesday (4/6) that the Indonesian government will provide a list of preferential tariffs for goods imported from the US before starting the second stage of trade negotiations scheduled for this month. Airlangga also mentioned that the Indonesian government is ready to accelerate negotiations with the US before the deadline of July 3, 2025.

marketNews.title: CATL and IBC EV Battery Ecosystem Groundbreaking Planned for Third Week of June 2025
marketNews.content: Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources, Bahlil Lahadalia, claimed on Tuesday (3/6) that the 6-7 billion US dollar electric vehicle battery ecosystem project belonging to Contemporary Amperex Technology Co. Ltd. (CATL) and Indonesia Battery Corporation (IBC) will begin groundbreaking in the third week of June 2025 in East Halmahera, North Maluku.

marketNews.title: China's Manufacturing PMI Drops to 48.3 in May 2025, Lowest Since September 2022
marketNews.content: S&P Global noted that China's manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) fell to 48.3 in May 2025 (vs. Apr 2025: 50.4), lower than the consensus expectation of 50.6. This result marks the lowest Chinese manufacturing PMI since September 2022, sekaligus marking the first contraction in factory activity in the last 8 months amid the trade war with the US. Nevertheless, business sentiment strengthened, supported by hopes for an improvement in trade conditions.

marketNews.title: US Job Openings Increased to 7.39 Million in April 2025
marketNews.content: The US Bureau of Labor Statistics recorded that job openings in the US increased by 191,000 to approximately 7.39 million in April 2025, exceeding the consensus expectation of 7.1 million.

tickerNews.title: PGEO to Distribute Dividend of IDR 53/Share, Indicating a 4% Yield
tickerNews.content: $PGEO: Pertamina Geothermal Energy will distribute dividends for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to 136.4 million US dollars or approximately 53.1 rupiah per share, equivalent to an 85% dividend payout ratio (vs. 2023: ~78.5%). This amount indicates a dividend yield of 4% as of Wednesday (4/6). The cum date in the regular and negotiation markets is June 13, 2025, while the payment date is July 4, 2025.

tickerNews.title: DSSA Acquires Land from BSDE for Data Center Expansion
tickerNews.content: $BSDE: Dian Swastatika Sentosa ($DSSA) acquired land area of 8,516 square meters in Menteng Atas, South Jakarta from Bumi Serpong Damai for 617.4 billion rupiah. This plan is in line with the company's business expansion plan in the data center sector.

tickerNews.title: MEDC Shareholders Approve 2024 Dividend Distribution, Implying Final Yield of 2%
tickerNews.content: $MEDC: Medco Energi Internasional shareholders on Tuesday (3/6) approved the plan to distribute dividends for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to approximately 63.3 million US dollars or approximately 17% dividend payout ratio (vs. 2023: ~21%). This amount implies a final dividend of 25 rupiah per share, indicating a final dividend yield of 2% as of Wednesday (4/6). The cum date and payment date have not been announced. MEDC previously distributed an interim dividend for the 2024 fiscal year of 15.75 rupiah per share in November 2024.

tickerNews.title: CBDK Injects IDR 409 Billion into Two Subsidiaries, Increasing Ownership Stakes
tickerNews.content: $CBDK: Bangun Kosambi Sukses announced that it has injected a total of approximately 409 billion rupiah in funds to 2 of its subsidiaries, consisting of approximately 92 billion rupiah for PT Cahaya Gemilang Indah Cemerlang and approximately 317 billion rupiah for PT Mega Andalan Sukses. After this transaction, CBDK's ownership in both increased from 64.62% to 71.68% respectively. CBDK management explained that this transaction was carried out to increase the ownership portion in these two companies and reduce the dilution impact from the issuance of new shares.

tickerNews.title: WIFI Signs MOU with Telkom and PT Telkom Infrastruktur Indonesia on Network Infrastructure and National Internet Ecosystem Development
tickerNews.content: $WIFI: Solusi Sinergi Digital signed a memorandum of understanding for cooperation with Telkom Indonesia ($TLKM) and PT Telkom Infrastruktur Indonesia regarding network infrastructure and national internet ecosystem development. This memorandum of understanding covers infrastructure utilization, edge data center service optimization, and several other collaborations. This step is expected to proceed immediately to the technical implementation stage and can become a main catalyst in bringing "people's internet" services to more than 40 million households in Indonesia.

tickerNews.title: MITI Plans Private Placement of Up to 354 Million New Shares for Strategic Mineral Mining Business Development
tickerNews.content: $MITI: Mitra Investindo plans to conduct a private placement of up to approximately 354 million new shares with a dilution effect of up to 9.09%. The execution price and potential investors have not been announced. The proceeds from this corporate action are intended for business development in the strategic mineral mining sector, specifically silica, through the company's subsidiary, PT Nusantara Bina Silika. This plan will be discussed at the GMSLB on June 5, 2025.
